intro: Mesembryanthemum divergens, commonly known as the Cape groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they open in the morning, closing by midday. Mesembryanthemum divergens is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
